title: Rafael Devers to the Giants?! Grading a shocking blockbuster
content: The Red Sox stunned the baseball world Sunday, trading their $313.5 million All-Star to San Francisco.

title: Red Sox deal All-Star Devers to Giants in stunner
content: The Giants are sending Jordan Hicks, Kyle Harrison, outfield prospect James Tibbs III and pitching prospect Jose Bello to the Red Sox for Rafael Devers.

title: Spaun captures first major title, wins U.S. Open
content: J.J. Spaun, 34, who started Sunday one stroke behind 54-hole leader Sam Burns, survived a terrible start and challenging elements to pull away from the pack and capture his first major title with a two-stroke win in the U.S. Open at Oakmont Country Club.

title: Ohtani to return to mound vs. Padres on Monday
content: Shohei Ohtani will make his long-awaited return to pitching Monday night in a matchup against the division-rival San Diego Padres.

title: Grizzlies send Bane to Magic in blockbuster trade
content: The Grizzlies traded Desmond Bane to the Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Cole Anthony, four unprotected first-round picks and one first-round pick swap.

title: USMNT ends skid, nets 5 in Gold Cup opening win
content: Malik Tillman scored twice as the United States built a three-goal, first-half lead and ended a four-game losing streak by routing Trinidad and Tobago 5-0 on Sunday in a Concacaf Gold Cup opener.

title: Sky's Reese 2nd youngest to record triple-double
content: Angel Reese had 11 points, 11 assists and 13 rebounds for her first career triple-double in the Sky's 78-66 win over the Sun on Sunday.

title: Judge 1-for-12 as NY swept: Got to swing at strikes
content: Aaron Judge blamed himself for swinging at pitches outside the strike zone as the Yankees were swept in a three-game series at the Red Sox.

title: Braves lose, waste Holmes' 15-strikeout effort
content: Atlanta starter Grant Holmes pitched five hitless innings and ended with a career-best 15 strikeouts on Sunday afternoon, but the Braves faltered in the end, dropping a 10-1 decision to the Colorado Rockies, a loss that dropped them to 31-39 this season.

title: ✍  Deals NBA stars should get this summer
content: A $125 million deal for Giddey? Who could give $80 million to Kuminga? See what our resident GM is offering 10 star free agents.

title: How J.J. Spaun battled Oakmont, rain and bad breaks for a U.S. Open title
content: Oakmont was almost unplayable Sunday afternoon in the rain. But in the end, it was exactly what Spaun needed to become one of the unlikeliest U.S. Open champions.

title: What Sunday's shocking trade means for the East, the KD saga and the NBA draft
content: Sunday's shocking deal has ramifications far beyond Orlando and Memphis -- including the Kevin Durant trade saga.

title: Grading the Bane trade between Orlando and Memphis
content: The NBA offseason is almost here, and deals are already underway. Catch up on the latest trade grades.

title: 'The secret sauce': Inside the closets of superstars SGA and Tyrese Haliburton
content: From clutch performances to fashion icons, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's and Tyrese Haliburton's closets contain the magic.

title: Malik Tillman shines as USMNT secures a much-needed win
content: Malik Tillman was the USMNT's best as Mauricio Pochettino’s team bounced back from a rough week to open its Gold Cup with a 5-0 victory.

title: Texas State, cryptic posts and the Pac-12's next move
content: Texas State looms as the favorite to join the Pac-12. Why could that happen? What would come next? And what about Memphis?

title: Panthers within one win of a Cup repeat: Grades for both teams, outlook for Game 6
content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

title: Bayern Munich's ruthless win in Club World Cup sets new FIFA record
content: Bayern Munich clobbered an amateur team in the Club World Cup, setting a new all-time record in FIFA competitions.

title: Poch: U.S. needed win after losses, recent 'noise'
content: SAN JOSE, Calif. -- United States coach Mauricio Pochettino welcomed the positives vibes from a tournament-opening 5-0 Gold Cup win over Trinidad and Tobago at PayPal Park that snapped a recent four-game losing streak.

title: Delap challenged to earn No. 9 after Chelsea move
content: Enzo Maresca believes Liam Delap has the potential to become England's main striker, but warned the 22-year-old he faces a fight to get into the Chelsea line-up first.

title: Musiala nets hat trick, Bayern hit 10 to start CWC
content: Bayern Munich began their Club World Cup campaign in emphatic fashion with a ruthless 10-0 demolition of Auckland City on Sunday, as Jamal Musiala marked his return from injury with a brilliant second-half hat trick in a commanding team display.

title: PSG 'hungry' to add Club World Cup to UCL win
content: Luis Enrique said his Paris Saint-Germain team are "hungry" to add the Club World Cup to their Champions League success, after beating Atlético Madrid 4-0 in the opening game in Group B.

title: Italy great Gattuso named country's new coach
content: Former midfield great Gennaro Gattuso has been appointed as Italy's new head coach following Luciano Spalletti exit from the national team.

title: Angel City wear shirts supporting 'immigrant city'
content: Angel City, the NWSL team based in Los Angeles, distributed T-shirts to fans on Saturday that proclaimed "Immigrant City Football Club."

title: Cherki eyes Ballon d'Or after Man City transfer
content: Rayan Cherki has said he is hoping that Manchester City can provide the platform to win the Ballon d'Or following his move from Lyon.

title: McLaren feared disharmony, but Norris' contrition will go a long way
content: Sunday was the lowest point of his season so far, but Lando Norris faced the situation with a refreshing honesty not often seen at the top level of motor racing.

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins Cup race at Mexico City
content: Shane van Gisbergen once again mastered a new track to win NASCAR's first Cup Series points-paying race outside the United States in the modern era.

title: Carlota Ciganda takes LPGA Classic; first win in eight years
content: Carlota Ciganda birdied the final two holes to win the Meijer LPGA Classic on Sunday for her first LPGA Tour victory in more than 8 1/2 years.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: The NBA draft's best at 20 different traits, skills: Where Flagg, Bailey and Fears stand out
content: Best clutch player? Top on-ball defender? Elite court vision? We hand out superlatives for this year's class.

title: How Aaliyah Chavez and her dad bonded through basketball
content: With Father's Day here, the OU signee and her dad reflect on a relationship forged through tough practices together -- a bond that might not have otherwise existed.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye trio of free agents
content: Real Madrid eye a trio of targets, including Liverpool's Ibrahima Konate. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: How should the Blues trim their squad before next season?
content: Fresh off winning the UEFA Europa Conference League and finishing in the top four, what must manager Enzo Maresca & Co. do this offseason to prepare and refine their squad?

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Can anyone stop Kansas City?
content: When the Kansas City Current are firing on all cylinders, there's no stopping them. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Caste census report could not be implemented due to opposition from some sections in Karnataka, regrets Congress MLC Yathindra Siddaramaiah
content: Addressing public meeting in Mandya, he called upon the gathering to introspect and support only leaders who fought for their rights

title: Pune bridge collapse: Police continue search operation; Fadnavis says Indrayani river bridge was declared dangerous
content: Search operation at collapsed iron bridge site in Pune continues; authorities say the iron structure collapsed due to overcrowding by tourists who ignored the warning board at the spot

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Ex-CM Rupani's mortal remains handed over to kin
content: The last rites of Rupani will be held in his hometown Rajkot after a funeral procession on Monday evening.

title: Five killed, 18 injured as pick-up van overturns in Bihar's Saran
content: According to locals, despite attempts to regain control, the vehicle veered off the road and overturned

title: Kedarnath helicopter crash: Case registered against private helicopter firm
content: The Bell 407 helicopter, which crashed due to bad weather in the forests of Gauri Mai Khark between Gaurikund and Triyuginarayan belonged to Aryan Aviation Private Limited

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: DNA tests identify 87 victims; 47 bodies handed over to kin
content: Earlier on June 15, samples of 250 victims, including persons on board the flight as well as those who were killed on the ground, have been collected for identification

title: India positioned to become world’s third-largest economy: PM Modi in Cyprus
content: PM Modi made the remarks as he attended a business roundtable on June 15 in Limassol, a city on the southern coast of Cyprus

title: Madras High Court summons MLA ‘Poovai’ Jagan Moorthy, ADGP Jayaram after they turn out to be suspects in abduction case
content: Justice P. Velmurugan orders that the MLA as well as the ADGP must be present in the court by afternoon since both were suspects in the crime

title: Bike taxi ban comes into effect in Karnataka, but some aggregators continue to operate
content: Thousands of commuters lamented the shutting down of bike taxis, an affordable transport service especially in cities, following an order by the Karnataka High Court.

title: Delhi-bound Air India flight returns to Hong Kong after pilot suspects technical issue: Sources
content: “The flight has landed safely in Hong Kong, all passengers have disembarked and the aircraft is undergoing inspection,” sources said

title: Census 2027: Centre issues notification; to be conducted in 2 phases
content: The census will be carried out with a reference date of October 1, 2026 in snow-bound areas like Ladakh and March 1, 2027 in the rest of the country, the notification said

title: Karnataka government issues draft notification increasing stilt parking height to 4.5 metres
content: The additional height will not be calculated for the height of the building for the purpose of property tax and other regulations

title: Rain continues to lash Kerala; orange alert for rivers as water level rises
content: Thennala in Malappuram recorded the extreme category of rainfall with the weather station recording 21 cm of rains in just 24 hours ending at 8.30 a.m. on Monday

title: Leopard rescued by forest officials in Andhra
content: A bone reportedly got stuck in the leopard’s throat and veterinary doctors are attending to it, officials said

title: KTR appears before ACB in Formula-E Race case
content: The former Minister alleged that the Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy is mulling to get him arrested in the case

title: Few places receive light showers in Andhra
content: The IMD  had predicted isolated heavy rainfall for the region of North Coastal Andhra Pradesh until Monday

title: Heavy rain, gusty winds lash Kozhikode district of Kerala
content: Kozhikode on red alert. District Collector has declared a holiday for all educational institutions for Monday

title: 50-year-old biker dies after branch falls on him in Chikkamagaluru district of Karnataka
content: In another incident, a 100-year-old woman died and two others suffered injuries after a wall in a house collapsed during heavy rains in Shivamogga taluk

title: TMC's Abhishek criticises Centre for 'lack' of accountability over Pahalgam attack
content: Calling it a "massive breach in national security", Abhishek Banerjee asked who would take responsibility for the "failure"

title: Israel-Iran conflict: India starts relocating its citizens from Tehran to safer places within Iran, as Indian officials work on an evacuation plan
content: According to sources, buses have started relocating students from Tehran University of Medical Sciences, Islamic Azad University Tehran Medical Sciences, Iran University of Medical Sciences (Tehran)

title: Congress claims SEBI's Adani probe hampered by lack of information sharing by tax-haven countries
content: The Cyprus-based fund New Leaina has reportedly about $420 million in Adani companies, Cpngress claimed

title: Filmmaker missing after Ahmedabad plane crash; kin fear he may be among ground victims
content: The last known location of filmmaker Mahesh Kalawadia’s mobile phone was traced to just 700 metres away from the accident site

title: With monsoon rains, pothole menace makes a comeback with a vengeance in Bengaluru
content: Citizens have pointed out that filling potholes is not enough. What was needed was interventions to ensure the roads are not waterlogged with every rain.

title: Traffic diverted away from bridges as rain continues to lash north Karnataka
content: Parwad in Belagavi and Kodkani in Uttara Kannada have received more than 120 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours

title: Heavy rain batters Kannur, Kasaragod districts in Kerala; holiday declared for educational institutions
content: Authorities remain on high alert as water levels at Manjeswaram, Puthige, Madhur, and Uppala river gauge stations crossed danger marks on Monday morning

title: Boston Institute of Analytics opens centre in Hubballi
content: The institute’s first centre in north Karnataka is all set to offer courses in data sciences, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and allied fields starting July 1

title: Three-year-old dies after ambulance stuck in massive traffic jam in Kerala’s Kannur
content: Officials say traffic congestion was caused by temple festival at Kottiyoor which saw a huge influx of devotees over the weekend

title: Cute new additions in Visakhapatnam zoo: Wallaby joey and mouse deer
content: Wallaby joey and mouse deer fawn add to the growing zoo family in Visakhapatnam’s Indira Gandhi Zoological Park

title: Monsoon escapes: Discover four stunning waterfalls in Andhra Pradesh’s Eastern Ghats
content: We journey through the waterfalls of the Eastern Ghats where rain-fed streams turn into natural marvels during the monsoon

title: Pune bridge collapse: Congress demands accountability, calls for questions to be asked of those in power
content: Each life lost in this avoidable disaster is a painful reminder of the cost of neglect, Pawan Khera said, adding that public safety should not be an afterthought.

title: 'Not an era of war': PM Modi urges peace amid West Asia tensions
content: Narendra Modi received Cyprus's highest honor, the Grand Cross of the Order of Makarios III. He stated that the award represents respect for India and strong Cyprus-India relations. The award recognizes contributions to Cyprus or humanity. Modi's visit is the first by an Indian Prime Minister in over twenty years.

title: Watch: New video shows AI crash survivor emerging from burning wreckage
content: A newly surfaced video shows Vishwash Kumar Ramesh, the lone survivor of the devastating Air India AI 171 crash near Ahmedabad, being led away from the wreckage. The flight, carrying 242 passengers and crew, crashed shortly after takeoff on June 12, killing 241 onboard and later claiming the lives of 33 more on the ground.

title: 'Earlier, I used to beat Indians at will': What global chess stars say about India's dominance
content: Gukesh Dommaraju's rise to world chess champion at 18 has sparked a chess revolution, validating Garry Kasparov's prediction. At the Delhi International Open, seasoned players like GM Tornike Sanikidze noted the fierce competition from India's young talents. Veteran Rani Hamid acknowledged India's significant progress in chess. India is now a dominant force, driven by ambitious young players.

title: Watch: Iran missiles seen streaking across Jerusalem skies
content: Tensions escalate as Iranian missiles target Jerusalem, prompting strong Israeli response. An Israeli minister accuses Iran's Supreme Leader of ordering attacks on civilians, while officials claim air superiority over Tehran. Netanyahu announces Operation Rising Lion to neutralize Iran's nuclear capabilities, as Khamenei vows retaliation, escalating the conflict.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: To circumvent US AI chip restrictions, Chinese firms are creatively processing data abroad, exemplified by engineers transporting hard drives to Malaysian data centers for AI model training. Southeast Asia is becoming a strategic hub with rapidly expanding data-center capacity, while the Middle East also attracts Chinese AI developers, highlighting the challenges of enforcing US export controls.

title: 'For 1.4 billion Indians': Cyprus confers highest honour on PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was honoured with Cyprus' highest civilian award, the Grand Cross of the Order of Makarios III, which he dedicated to the 1.4 billion people of India. This visit marks the first by an Indian PM since 2002 and gains importance due to Cyprus' ongoing conflict with Turkey.

title: Honeymoon murder: Trekker shares last vid of Raja Raghuvanshi with Sonam
content: A tourist's video may hold key evidence in Raja Raghuvanshi's murder case. The video shows Raja and Sonam on their honeymoon in Meghalaya. Dev Singh, the tourist, unknowingly recorded them near a living root bridge. Sonam and others are accused of plotting Raja's murder. Police investigation continues to build a strong case against the accused.

title: Big e-Aadhaar revamp! No more photocopies required; check top steps
content: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) is set to revamp e-Aadhaar, introducing a QR code-based system to eliminate need for physical copies. Updates, excluding biometrics, will be automated through integrated databases, reducing center visits.

title: Jobs in AI era: LinkedIn founder to Gen Z graduates; You will become 'enormously attractive' if...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman encourages young people to embrace AI as a tool for job hunting, viewing them as "AI natives" who can help older professionals adapt.

title: 'You destroyed them': Yograj Singh claims BCCI wanted to sack MS Dhoni
content: Yograj Singh has criticized the BCCI selectors from the early 2010s for allegedly mishandling the careers of senior players after the 2011 World Cup victory. He claims key players like Gautam Gambhir, Yuvraj Singh, and others were unfairly sidelined following poor overseas tours.

title: Ind vs Eng: Without Virat and Rohit, who will be India's best bet with bat?
content: India's Test tour of England marks a generational shift as KL Rahul, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Shubman Gill shoulder the batting responsibilities in the absence of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Rahul aims for consistency, while Jaiswal faces his biggest challenge yet.

title: Google, Microsoft & Musk's xAI 'cut ties' with ScaleAI; 'reason' is Facebook founder
content: Google is reportedly cutting ties with Scale AI after Meta's significant investment, raising data security concerns among major clients like Microsoft and xAI. These companies fear proprietary data exposure to a competitor. Google, initially planning a $200 million payment to Scale this year, is actively shifting its workload to rivals, potentially impacting Scale's operations.

title: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised due to stomach ailments: Doc says she's stable
content: Sonia Gandhi, the 78-year-old Congress Parliamentary Party Chairperson, is in stable condition at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital, where she is being treated for a stomach ailment since Sunday evening. Prior to her hospitalization, she had a medical check-up on June 9 and underwent tests in Shimla for elevated blood pressure, where doctors reported her condition as stable.

title: IND vs ENG: The series that lasted a year - Why India's 2021 tour was halted midway
content: The 2021 India-England Test series saw intense battles and a rare disruption, with the final Test delayed by a year due to COVID-19. It resumed in 2022, ending 2-2, and remains a symbol of resilience amid global uncertainty.

title: Wayne Gretzky caught in backlash; Trump calls him ‘a free agent’; Canadians question his loyalty
content: Wayne Gretzky, a Canadian icon, faces backlash for his association with Donald Trump, particularly after Trump's remarks about Canada. Critics question Gretzky's Canadian identity, fueled by images of him at Trump events. Despite Gretzky's attempts to remain neutral, his silence on Trump's policies and his wife's social media activity have intensified the controversy, potentially impacting his legacy in Canada.

title: Gold rate today: Gold prices at record high of Rs 1.01L; what’s the outlook?
content: Gold rate today: Gold prices surged to a record high of Rs 1,01,078 per 10 grams, driven by global equity pressures and rising crude oil prices. Silver futures also remained stable near peak levels. Analysts suggest that geopolitical tensions and a weakening dollar index are influencing precious metal prices, advising caution and adherence to specified trading levels.

title: K'taka Bike taxi ban: Rapido says it 'paused' services; Ola, Uber continue
content: Karnataka's ban on bike taxis is now in effect following a High Court order. Rapido has paused its bike taxi services, introducing 'Bike Parcel' instead. Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy warned of strict action against non-compliant aggregators. While Uber and Ola continued offering bike taxi services, the Transport Department maintains that using private vehicles for commercial purposes is illegal

title: Mid-air scare: Air India's Delhi-bound flight returns to Hong Kong
content: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner, flight AI-315, en route to Delhi from Hong Kong, was compelled to return to Hong Kong airport on Monday morning due to a suspected technical malfunction detected mid-air.

title: US embassy damaged in Israel: Iran missiles strike Tel Aviv; comes after Trump's warning
content: The US Embassy in Israel sustained minor damage due to Iranian missile strikes near its Tel Aviv branch, confirmed the US Ambassador. While no injuries were reported among US personnel, the embassy and consulate will remain closed due to the ongoing security situation.

title: AI crash: 22 Boeing 787 Dreamliners inspected; 11 more to go after DGCA orders
content: Following a recent Air India Dreamliner crash after departing from Ahmedabad, the airline is performing enhanced inspections on its Boeing 787 fleet, as instructed by the DGCA.

title: Gautam Gambhir set to rejoin Team India on June 17 in England
content: While head coach Gautam Gambhir was away, India’s assistant coaches Sitanshu Kotak, Ryan ten Doeschate, and Morne Morkel took charge of the team for a four-day intra-squad game against India A in Beckenham.

title: Gastroenterologist shares 3 effective remedies to relieve farting
content: Experiencing embarrassing gas? Gastroenterologist Dr. Joseph Salhab suggests remedies like simethicone to break up gas bubbles and peppermint tea for abdominal relief. Pepto Bismol can also reduce odor. The article further advises eating slowly, limiting gas-producing foods, avoiding gum and carbonated drinks, and quitting smoking to manage excessive flatulence.

title: Census 2027 process begins: Govt issues notification; first population count since 2011
content: India is set to conduct Census 2027, initiating the first population count since 2011, as notified by the Home Ministry. This census will uniquely include caste enumeration for the first time. The reference date is March 1, 2027, for most regions, and October 1, 2026, for Ladakh and snow-bound areas of Jammu and Kashmir, Uttarakhand, and Himachal Pradesh.

title: TS Inter Supplementary results for 1st, 2nd year released: Check link to download marks memo
content: Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education released TS Inter Supplementary Results 2025. The results are available on tgbie.cgg.gov.in and results.cgg.gov.in. Students can check results using hall ticket number. Supplementary exams occurred from May 22 to May 29. The marks memo can be downloaded from the website. It contains student details and subject-wise marks.

title: ‘No Gods or Kings’: Musk posts cryptic message — Here’s the video game that inspired it
content: Elon Musk ignited speculation with a cryptic post, "No gods or kings, only man," shared amidst anti-Trump protests and the anniversary of the US Army. He later reiterated the phrase alongside a SpaceX Starship test video, potentially emphasising human achievement and individual empowerment. The phrase originates from a video game, linked to themes of human autonomy.

title: Filmmaker goes missing after Air India plane crash; wife fears he may be among ground victims: ‘We have submitted DNA samples’
content: Filmmaker Mahesh Kalawadia has been missing since the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad on June 12th. He was last seen near the crash site, and his phone was switched off shortly after the plane took off. His family has submitted a DNA sample to identify him among the victims killed on the ground during the tragic accident.

title: UK appoints first woman to head spy agency MI6: Meet real-life 'M' character; Who is Blaise Metreweli?
content: Blaise Metreweli, a Cambridge University alumna with a distinguished career in intelligence, has been appointed as the first female head of MI6. Succeeding Richard Moore, she will assume the role in the autumn. Her appointment comes at a crucial time, as the UK faces unprecedented threats, highlighting the vital importance of intelligence services.

title: Iran fires fresh missiles at Israel; vows further attacks on 'vital targets'
content: Tensions escalate as Israel and Iran exchange missile strikes, defying global calls for de-escalation. Israeli airstrikes inside Iran targeted nuclear and energy sites, resulting in over 230 deaths. Iran retaliated with missile barrages, causing casualties and damage in Israel. Nuclear talks are suspended amidst fears of wider regional conflict, with both sides signaling no immediate end to hostilities.

title: India’s 1st semiconductor unit: Gujarat enables 1,500 apartments; mainly for Tata Group staff
content: Tata Group is establishing India's first semiconductor fabrication facility in Dholera, Ahmedabad. Gujarat is supporting the project by building residential accommodations for Tata employees and vendors. The project includes 1,500 residential units, a fire station, school, hospital and desalination plant. The first chip production is expected by December 2026.

title: Photos: ICC chief Jay Shah attends MLC double-header at Oakland Coliseum
content: ICC chief Jay Shah attended the MLC 2025 doubleheader, meeting franchise owners, ex-cricketers, and stakeholders including Anil Kumble and Adam Gilchrist. He also engaged with CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan and KKR’s Venky Mysore, highlighting growing global interest in the league.

title: UFO sightings in US: New report reveals truth behind the surge; a human-made disinformation
content: A recent government report suggests that numerous UFO sightings in the US may be attributed to military disinformation campaigns and covert operations rather than extraterrestrial encounters. The All-domain Anomaly Resolution Office (AARO) uncovered strategies used since the Cold War, including staged evidence and misleading briefings, to obscure classified aircraft programs.

title: 'Didn't have permit to land': Hyd-bound Lufthansa flight gets bomb threat; forced to return mid-air
content: A Lufthansa flight bound for Hyderabad from Frankfurt was compelled to return to its origin due to a bomb threat received while the aircraft was outside Indian airspace. Initially, passengers were informed that the diversion was due to a denial of landing permission at Hyderabad. Passengers have been provided accommodation and are scheduled to fly out the next morning.

title: Watch: Smoke scare on Saudia Haj flight triggers emergency landing at Lucknow airport
content: A Saudia aircraft arriving in Lucknow from Jeddah experienced a smoke incident in its landing gear upon arrival on Sunday. Prompt action by the Airport Rescue and Fire Fighting team and the Saudia crew ensured the safe deboarding of all passengers, primarily Haj pilgrims. A minor hydraulic oil leak in the landing gear is suspected to be the cause.

title: Rain batters Mumbai again: Flight ops hit, commuters stranded
content: Mumbai experienced heavy rainfall on June 16, 2025, with the city area receiving the highest intensity. Wadala recorded the highest rainfall at 161.4 mm, followed by Matunga at 147.55 mm. Bandra in the western suburbs saw 134.59 mm, while Chembur led the eastern suburbs with 111 mm.

title: 'Not slept in 3 days': Fear grips Indian students in Iran amid Israel tensions
content: Amidst escalating Israel-Iran tensions, Indian students in Iran are pleading with the Indian government for evacuation, citing safety concerns due to recent aerial attacks near residential areas. Students describe being jolted awake by explosions and express fear for their survival, especially with restricted airspace complicating their return home.

title: Post deleted! Kuldeep Yadav shares photos with fiancée Vanshika, later removes it
content: Kuldeep Yadav briefly posted a photo with fiancée Vanshika after their June 4 engagement in Lucknow, only to delete it soon after. While fans speculated the reason, the spinner remains focused on India's upcoming Test series in England starting June 20.

title: Women’s WC 2025: Ind vs Pak date confirmed; here’s all you need to know
content: India will face Pakistan in Colombo on October 5 during the 2025 Women’s ODI World Cup, hosted by India and Sri Lanka. The marquee clash follows a hybrid model due to political tensions, with Pakistan’s matches held in neutral Sri Lanka.

title: Arjun Kapoor reacts to ex-girlfriend Malaika Arora's post on 'love'
content: Arjun Kapoor recently liked Malaika Arora's Instagram post featuring a quote about love, sparking curiosity among fans after their breakup last year. The gesture suggests an amicable relationship between the former couple, who were together for six years. Arjun subtly confirmed his single status earlier this year, while Malaika prefers to keep her personal life private.

title: Actor Ram Kapoor buys Lamborghini Urus SE SUV worth Rs 4.57 crore: See details
content: Actor Ram Kapoor has recently acquired a Lamborghini Urus SE, priced at Rs 4.57 crore. This plug-in hybrid SUV boasts an impressive 800 hp and can reach 100 kmph in just 3.4 seconds. The Urus SE features design updates, a new infotainment screen, and joins Kapoor's collection of luxury vehicles like Porsche and Ferrari.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Vijay Rupani's last rites today; to be held with state honours
content: Preparations are underway to conduct the last rites of former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani, who tragically died in a plane crash in Ahmedabad last week. His mortal remains will be handed over to his family in Ahmedabad and then transported to Rajkot for the final rites, which will be performed with full state honors at 5 pm.

title: India, US close to finalising 'early tranche' of trade deal
content: India and the US are nearing completion of the initial phase of a bilateral trade agreement, aiming to finalize the text before July 9. India is considering concessions on agricultural products and automobiles in exchange for a 10% duty on labor-intensive goods like textiles and footwear.

title: IND vs ENG: Karun Nair – 'A prominent Indian cricketer advised me to retire'
content: Karun Nair, poised for a Test comeback after eight years, revealed a senior Indian cricketer once urged him to retire for league riches. Defying advice, Nair's domestic dominance and resilience earned him a spot in India’s squad for England Tests.

title: Amitabh Kant resigns as G20 Sherpa after 45 years in govt service
content: Amitabh Kant, a retired IAS officer, concludes his 45-year public service career, stepping down as India's G20 Sherpa. He expressed gratitude to the Prime Minister for the opportunity to contribute to India's development through initiatives like Make in India and Startup India. Kant now aims to support India's progress by working with startups and academic institutions.

title: Uttarakhand chopper crash: Couple let sick teen, her grandmother board first
content: A Maharashtra couple, Pooja and Pravin Mahajan, narrowly escaped a fatal helicopter crash near Kedarnath due to an act of kindness. They allowed a sick teenager and her grandmother to board the helicopter first, inadvertently saving their own lives as the same helicopter crashed minutes after takeoff, killing Pooja's sister, her husband, and their toddler daughter.

title: AI and biomanufacturing: can India’s policies match its ambitions?
content: When an AI model is used to control a bioreactor, how do we know it’s reliable? Who checks that the data it was trained on is representative of India’s diverse conditions, or that it won’t make a catastrophic error if something unexpected happens? These aren’t just technical questions. They are matters of public trust and safety

title: CPI (Maoist) condemns Operation Kagar, calls for bandh in TG, A.P. on June 20
content: CPI (Maoist) calls for bandh in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh on June 20 against Operation Kagar killings

title: FLO’s rural skill centre to empower women opened in Bhongir
content: The objective behind setting up of the centre is to transform lives of rural women by equipping them with employable skills and entrepreneurial capabilities

title: Madurai Bench of Madras High Court directs organisers of Lord Murugan conference to ensure communal harmony
content: The Madurai Bench of Madras HC also modified certain conditions imposed by the police for the conduct of Muruga Bakthargalin Aanmeega Maanadu on June 22 and its pre-event in Madurai

title: State govt.’s intervention sought to ensure better facilities at Beypore harbour
content: Demand for a government-run boat maintenance yard continues to be ignored, forcing many operators to rely on costly private services, allege action committee members

title: Chennai-bound British Airways flight returns to London after ‘technical snag’
content: The flight was operated by a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner aircraft; a Frankfurt-Hyderabad flight also returned to base after a bomb threat

title: Mananchira–Vellimadukunnu Road work to begin today amid row over second stretch
content: CPI(M) claims Ministry of Road Transport and Highways yet to permit govt. to proceed with work on Malaparamba–Vellimadukunnu stretch

title: Mortal remains of former Gujarat CM Rupani, over 40 victims identified through DNA profiling; Air India contacts relatives of all victims
content: Gujarat Health Minister Rushikesh Patel says funeral of the former Chief Minister will be held at Rajkot on Monday with full State honours; 24 bodies already handed over to grieving families

title: Wayanad records high rainfall between June 2024 and May 2025, says Hume Centre
content: By analysing data from all stations, it was found that the district received an average rainfall of nearly 4,000 mm during this period, says the centre

title: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised for stomach-related issues in Delhi
content: Sonia Gandhi admitted to hospital for stomach-related issues, stable condition under doctor’s observation

title: BJP ally Tipra Motha seeks PM's intervention for 'pushing back' illegal immigrants in Tripura
content: A 15-member delegation of the TMP, led by Animesh Debbarma, met Governor N. Indrasena Reddy on Saturday and handed over a memorandum

title: NIA files chargesheet against three accused in Punjab grenade attack case linked to Khalistan Zindabad Force
content: The NIA has invoked various provisions of the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act and the Explosive Substances Act

title: Israel-Iran tension: Kashmiri students in Iran feel ‘traumatised’, parents seek PM’s intervention
content: J&K CM Omar Abdullah said he was in touch with the Ministry of External Affairs regarding the evolving situation in Iran with regard to Kashmiri students in Tehran, Shiraz, Qom, and other Iranian cities

title: IndiGo Airbus A320 aircraft tail scrapes runway, industry sources say; airline denies ‘tail strike’ report
content: IndiGo acknowledges an incident occurred, but refuses to characterise it as a tail strike; there have been six such incidents by IndiGo A321s since 2023; AAIB yet to release report on its probe into tail strikes

title: Air India Ahmedabad plane crash: International agencies reach Ahmedabad to assist in crash probe
content: Downloading and analysing black box could take four to five days; personnel from U.S. and U.K. arrive in Ahmedabad; UN norms state that a country probing an accident should produce a preliminary report within 30 days

title: Raj Bhavan and the ruling NC in Kashmir spar over offer of jobs to family of local Pahalgam terror victim
content: The L-G’s office said the appointment was made by exercising discretionary powers vested with it, the NC said the job order had already been prepared by the J&K Fisheries Department

title: Awards from government deserve special respect, says Dil Raju
content: The Chairman of the Film Development Corporation and film producer was not happy on top stars skipping the film awards

title: AISF demands criminal action against FIITJEE for downing shutters without notice
content: AISF State vice president alleges that the institute collected huge amounts towards fees a year in advance from students; however claiming losses, they have been shutting down centres one after another

title: India must stand with international law and UN charter: Ukraine Minister
content: Ahead of possible Modi-Zelenskyy meeting at G-7 in Canada, Minister says Ukraine will welcome any Indian move to facilitate talks with Russia

title: India-origin man dies days after Australian police allegedly knelt on his neck
content: Gaurav Kundi was rushed to a hospital after his condition declined, and he ‘became unresponsive’ during the attempted arrest

title: One dead after landslip hits Kedarnath walking route, yatra suspended from Sonpryag till further orders
content: Citing safety concerns amid the adverse weather, the Rudrapryag Police appealed to the devotees coming to Kedarnath temple to remain safe wherever they are

title: ‘Beef’ near temple in Goalpara district now, five arrested
content: Lakhipur town has been tense since the body part of a cow was found near a Kali temple on Saturday night

title: I can never step onto a plane, says teen who became key witness after recording Air India flight crash in Ahmedabad
content: The 17-year-old had arrived in Ahmedabad just an hour back and had shot the video to show his friends back in village

title: Gas leak continues at Assam ONGC well after three days of blowout, 70 families shifted
content: An official said ‘the well killing process’ is going on and a crisis management team is working on war-footing to control the leakage

title: World Crocodile Day: Odisha’s pioneering efforts have made it a leader in crocodile conservation
content: Odisha is the only State to host the wild populations of all three native species — gharial, saltwater crocodile and mugger

title: Priyanka accuses LDF govt. of politicising welfare pension payment
content: At a roadshow in support of the United Democratic Front candidate in the Nilambur byelection, Ms. Vadra says lives and livelihoods of people should not be subject to political manipulations

title: Three West Bengal residents pushed into Bangladesh by BSF, return after State govt.’s intervention
content: Trinamool Congress MP Samirul Islam says that when the workers were picked up by the police in Mumbai, all necessary documents were provided by the State government

title: Israel-Iran Attack LIVE Updates: Iran's Khamenei Hid In Bunker To Escape Israeli Strike, Says Report
content: Iran-Israel Attack LIVE Updates: The military exchanges worsened between Israel and Iran overnight on Monday as strikes hit residential areas, killing and wounding civilians on both sides.

title: Video: Bengaluru Rapido Driver Slaps Woman Who Complained About His Driving
content: A video showing a Rapido bike taxi driver assaulting a woman passenger in Bengaluru's Jayanagar has gone viral on social media.

title: "Tehran Residents Will Soon Pay The Price": Israel's Big Warning For Iran
content: Israel has warned it would next hit civilian targets in Tehran in response to Iran's missile attacks, snubbing Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei as an "arrogant dictator".

title: "Humbled": PM Modi Conferred With Cyprus' Highest Civilian Honour
content: Prime Minister Modi on Monday was honoured with the Grand Cross of the Order of Makarios III of Cyprus, the country's highest civilian honour.

title: In Pics: Pune Bridge Collapse That Killed 4, Injured Dozens
content: Four people died and over 50 were injured when a nearly 30-year-old narrow bridge over the Indrayani River near Talegaon in Maharashtra's Pune district collapsed on Sunday afternoon.

title: Iran's Supreme Leader, Family Hiding In Bunkers Due To Israeli Strikes
content: Iranian state media officially confirmed that the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps' intelligence chief, Brigadier General Mohammad Kazemi and his deputy, Hassan Mohaqiq, were killed in an Israeli strike, The Times of Israel reported.

title: Air India Crash: DNA Matching Of 99 Completed, 64 Bodies Handed Over To Families
content: The Additional Medical Superintendent of Ahmedabad's Civil Hospital said on Monday that the DNA sample matches in the Air India plane crash have reached 99, corresponding to 87 individuals due to some duplication.

title: US Police Arrest Vance Boelter For Shooting Minnesota Lawmakers
content: Vance Luther Boelter, 57, was arrested on Sunday for allegedly killing a Minnesota Democratic state lawmaker and her husband while posing as a police officer.

title: "Itni Goliyan Maarungi": On Camera, UP Woman Points Gun At Gas Station Staff
content: The incident occurred on Sunday evening in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi, when a family reached a fuel station to get CNG refilled.

title: "We Could Have...": Siddaramaiah's Son Criticises Opposition To Caste Survey
content: The Congress central leadership has ordered that a new caste survey be held in Karnataka after the last survey sparked controversy with many sections disputing the findings.

title: Haryana Model's Throat Slit, Body Dumped In Canal In Sonipat
content: A missing person complaint against Sheetal was filed a few days ago, officials said. Upon investigation, they found her body in a canal near the Khanda village.

title: Ex Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani's Life And Legacy In 10 Pics
content: Vijay Rupani, a veteran leader of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and former Chief Minister of Gujarat, died in a tragic Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad.

title: "Broken Windows, Shattered Glass": Video Shows US Embassy In Israel Damaged In Iranian Strike
content: The Embassy of the United States in Tel Aviv was temporarily closed after the building sustained minor damage following an Iranian missile strike overnight, US Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee confirmed on Monday.

title: Uttarakhand Helicopter Crash: Pilot Was Going To Celebrate Birth Of Twins
content: A wave of grief engulfed the home of Lieutenant Colonel (Retd.) Rajveer Singh Chauhan, in Shastri Nagar, Jaipur, who died in a helicopter crash in Kedarnath, Uttarakhand.

title: Fake Dead Mother, Real Government Job: Shocking Scam In Madhya Pradesh
content: In a case that reads more like a bizarre crime novel than a bureaucratic slip-up, a massive scam has emerged from Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district education office.

title: Delhi-Bound Air India Flight Returns To Hong Kong, Technical Issue Suspected

title: 6 Workers Killed In Explosion At Firecracker Factory In UP's Amroha
content: At least six others have also sustained serious injuries and have been admitted to a hospital for treatment.

title: Minnesota Shooting Suspect Was Deeply Religious And Conservative, Say Friends
content: The man accused of assassinating the top Democrat in the Minnesota House held deeply religious and politically conservative views, telling a congregation in Africa two years ago that the US was in a "bad place" where churches didn't oppose abortion.
